IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO SUPPORT AGENCIES THAT PROVIDE CIVIL LEGAL SERVICES TO THE INDIGENT, THAT WORK TO IMPROVE THE ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE AND TO PROVIDE LAW STUDENT ASSISTANCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE TENNESSEE BAR FOUNDATION, A PHILANTHROPIC ORGANIZATION FOUNDED BY TENNESSEE LAWYERS, IS TO HONOR LAWYERS WHO HAVE DISTINGUISHED THEMSELVES IN THE PROFESSION AND COMMUNITY AND TO SUPPORT, WITH MONETARY GRANTS, ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE CIVIL LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO THE INDIGENT AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT WORK TO IMPROVE THE ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE.
IRS990.Desc: THE FOUNDATION AWARDS MONETARY GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS WHICH PROVIDE REPRESENTATION, IN CIVIL LEGAL MATTERS, TO INDIGENT CLIENTS. AMONG THOSE GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE FOUR ORGANIZATIONS SPECIFICALLY RESPONSIBLE FOR DEFINED GEOGRAPHIC AREAS, THEREFORE A MINIMUM AMOUNT OF LEGAL ASSISTANCE IS AVAILABLE IN ALL TENNESSEE COUNTIES. OTHER GRANT RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS EITHER SERVE SMALLER GEOGRAPHIC AREAS, LIMIT THEIR SERVICE BY SUBJECT MATTER OR, INSTEAD OF EMPLOYING STAFF LAWYERS, COORDINATE THE SERVICES OF LAWYERS IN PRIVATE PRACTICE WHO PROVIDE LEGAL ASSISTANCE ON A PRO BONO BASIS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE FOUNDATION AWARDS MONETARY GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS WHICH WORK TO IMPROVE THE ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE WITHIN THE STATE. THESE ORGANIZATIONS MAY ASSIST FAMILIES, CHILDREN, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE VICTIMS OR IMMIGRANTS WITH THEIR VERY SPECIFIC LEGAL NEEDS. OTHER GRANT RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS PROVIDE MEDIATION FOR DISPUTANTS OR REHABILITATION FOR OFFENDERS.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: MUTUAL FUNDS, ETFS, BOND FUNDS AND STOCKS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO SUPPORT THE COSTS OF THE FOUNDATION'S LEGAL HISTORY PROJECT AND FOR SUCH OTHER NEEDS AS THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES MAY DIRECT.

AS OF JUNE 30, 2023, THE FOUNDATION HAS ACCRUED NO INTEREST AND NO PENALTIES RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. IT IS THE FOUNDATION'S POLICY TO RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND/OR PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAX MATTERS IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: ARTS & BUSINESS COUNCIL OF GREATER NASHVILLE
LEGAL AID SOCIETY OF MIDDLE TN AND THE CUMBERLANDS
TENNESSEE COALITION TO END DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE
AGING SERVICES FOR THE UPPER CUMBERLANDS INC
YWCA KNOXVILLE AND THE TENNESSEE VALLEY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANT FUNDS ARE PAID TO RECIPIENTS ON A BI-ANNUAL SCHEDULE. NO RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION RECEIVES THE SECOND PAYMENT UNLESS A WRITTEN REPORT (DESIGNED BY THE FOUNDATION), THAT DESCRIBES THE ORGANIZATION'S PRIOR SIX MONTHS ACTIVITIES AND USE OF FUNDS, HAS BEEN COMPLETED AND SUBMITTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LAWYERS WHO HAVE DISTINGUISHED THEMSELVES IN THE PROFESSION AND COMMUNITY ARE ELECTED TO MEMBERSHIP AS "FELLOWS" BY COMMITTEES AND THE BOARD. IN ADDITION, THOSE LAWYERS PARTICIPATING IN THE TN IOLTA PROGRAM ARE ALSO MEMBERS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS ELECT THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AT AN ANNUAL MEETING

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION HAS MEMBERS WHO ELECT THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AT THE ANNUAL MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT FORM OF THE 990 WILL BE SENT BY E MAIL TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE TO REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ARE ASKED TO READ THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, TO INDICATE ANY CONFLICTS ON THE FORM PROVIDED AND TO SIGN THAT FORM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COMMITTEE COMPOSED OF CURRENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES CONSIDER THE PERFORMANCE OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND REVIEW THE SALARY SURVEY DATA COMPILED BY THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF IOLTA PROGRAMS (NAIP) TO DETERMINE COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENTS ARE ON FILE AND MAY BE SEEN ON REQUEST.
NO CHANGE IN POLICY FROM PRIOR YEAR.
